item.title: [SEC-3126] XML Parsing Error: undefined entity
item.description:
When I put @Secured(['ROLE_ADMIN']) as below, it occurs the following error:

@Secured(['ROLE_ADMIN'])
class RedeController

{ ... }

XML Parsing Error: undefined entity Location: ...
<a href="#">Skip to content…</a>
---------------------------------------^

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This doesn't appear to be enough information. Can you expand on your problem so I can understand/reproduce it?

OK Rob. I'm using grails. When I don't define the secured annotation, it works fine when I access http://localhost:8080/myAction/index:
"Sorry, you're not authorized to view this page."

So, when a have put the secured annotation as below

@Secured(['ROLE_ADMIN'])
class myActionController {

static allowedMethods = [save: "POST", update: "PUT", delete: "DELETE"]

def index(Integer max)

{ params.max = Math.min(max ?: 10, 100) respond myAction.list(params), model:[myActionCount: myAction.count()] }

...
}

When I access http://localhost:8080/myAction/index the following error is shown:

XML Parsing Error: undefined entity
Location: http://localhost:8080/myAction/index
Line Number 9, Column 45:

<a href="#list-myAction">Skip to content…</a>
---------------------------------------------------------^

Could you help me?

This still doesn't seem to be enough information. What is the complete stacktrace? What is the complete output of the HTML that is failing to parse? If you completely disable Spring Security do you still get the error?

No. if I disable Spring Security, it works fine. Furthermore, when I change to http:localhost:8080/rede/index.html works fine. But I know that's a bug because I don't need to authenticate for navigate. I'm using the default view generate by grails (see below).
